_metadata.description: Tier 3 Reference Data Summary - Supporting reference data for DHRUVA system

overview.description: Supporting reference data including officer hierarchies, district information, service catalogs, and SLA rules

officer_hierarchy.description: 106+ HODs across 30 departments with reporting chains
officer_hierarchy.extraction_method: Parse 'List of Depts with HOD.md' (5 pages, table format)

district_data.description: 26 AP districts with mandals, satisfaction scores, and audit data

service_catalog.description: 200+ government services from PGRS book with SLAs and requirements
service_catalog.extraction_method: Parse 'Service Registration reference.md' (96 revenue services) + PGRS BOOK subjects

sla_rules.description: SLA timelines and escalation rules by type and distress level
sla_rules.extraction_method: Formalize from distress_levels in grievance_types.json + domain rules

notes: Tier 3 files are referenced by Tier 1 core logic but not loaded on every request
These files provide context for routing, assignment, and analytics
SLA rules are most critical for production deployment
Officer hierarchy needed for proper grievance assignment workflow
District data enables geographic analytics and comparisons
Service catalog enables fine-grained subject classification beyond departments

interim_solution.sla_hours: Use default SLA from tier1_core/grievance_types.json → distress_levels → sla_hours
interim_solution.officer_assignment: Use HOD field from tier1_core/departments.json as default assignment
interim_solution.district_info: District names available in tier4_audit files (guntur_audit, constituency_preaudit)
interim_solution.services: Use common_subjects from tier1_core/departments.json as service proxy
